snippet: The Republican ticket has all but taken up residence in vital Ohio: Mitt Romney spent four days in the state this week and Representative Paul D. Ryan two, with plans to return Monday.
abstract: Polls suggest that the presidential race in Ohio, which had seemed to be slipping from Mitt Romney's grasp, has become a tighter contest; Romney's campaign has all but taken up residence in the vital state, with Romney and running mate Paul D Ryan barnstorming there.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and THOMAS KAPLAN
byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Portsmouth, and Thomas Kaplan from Youngstown, Ohio.

lead_paragraph: The Republican ticket has all but taken up residence in vital Ohio: Mitt Romney spent four days in the state this week and Representative Paul D. Ryan two, with plans to return Monday.

headline.seo: G.O.P. Ticket Focuses on Crucial Ohio Votes
headline.main: G.O.P. Ticket Focuses on Crucial Ohio Votes
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Ticket Focuses On Crucial Ohio Votes
